titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3045) to implement the Dominican Republic-Central America-United States Free Trade Agreement.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-186, by Mr. Dreier.

During consideration of H.R. 3045 pursuant to this resolution, notwithstanding the operation of the previous question, the Chair may postpone further consideration of the bill to a time designated by the Speaker in consonance with section 151 of the Trade Act of 1974. In addition, a motion to proceed to consideration of H.R. 3045 pursuant to section 151 of the Trade Act of 1974 shall be in order only if offered by the Majority Leader or his designee.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 68.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 386.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - The Chair put the question on adoption of the resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of adoption of the resolution until later in the legislative day.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 227 - 201 (Roll no. 442).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/27/2005--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3045) to implement the Dominican Republic-Central America-United States Free Trade Agreement.
